body.p: Helion CloudSystem 10.0 is designed for converged infrastructure environments and provides a software-defined approach to managing the cloud. Helion CloudSystem consists of two offerings: HPE Helion CloudSystem Foundation and HPE Helion CloudSystem Enterprise.

li.p: Helion CloudSystem Foundation is based on the Helion OpenStack Liberty distribution of OpenStack cloud software. It integrates hardware and software to deliver core Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) provisioning and life cycle management of compute, network, and storage resources. You manage Helion CloudSystem from its Operations Console and its CLIs. You develop, deploy, and scale cloud applications using the OpenStack user portal and the OpenStack APIs and CLIs.

HPE Helion Stackato (formerly Helion Development Platform) is an application platform or Platform as a Service (PaaS) that enables developers to rapidly develop, deploy, and scale cloud applications across a mix of public and private clouds. Stackato supports a wide and growing list of programming languages and technologies.

Helion CloudSystem Enterprise adds features in HPE Cloud Service Automation (HPE CSA) that integrate servers, storage, networking, security, and management to automate the life cycle for hybrid service delivery. Application architects can use Enterprise to create application and infrastructure templates and publish them as offerings in a service catalog. Users select offerings from a catalog and request provisioning of a new service instance, or subscription. When a service is requested, Enterprise automatically provisions the servers, storage, and networking into a subscription.

Helion CloudSystem Enterprise includes an embedded version of HPE Operations Orchestration (OO), which backs HPE CSA orchestration with the content and automation to provision and maintain subscriptions. OO can also be used to automate administrative or run-book processes.
